COMPANY OF FRIENDS — TEMPTING FATE PAGE 1
NARRATION

I’m Bernice Summerfield, friends call me Benny, and I’m, er, from the twenty-seventh century. I’m an archaeology professor, although I gave up my chair to go freelance when... no, let's not get into that here. Let’s see - I travelled with the Doctor for a very long time... I think he was in his seventh body then. I met him on the planet Heaven and fought the Hoothi, a race of monsters who looked like giant .. um .. mushrooms. We had dozens of adventures. Went all across time and space.

Anyway, to cut a long story short, I left the Doctor and eventually he regenerated into a rather dashing chap with long hair. I only met that Doctor a few times. The first was in 1997. Blimey, was it really that long ago? Anyway - big spaceships over London, the Ice Warriors invaded - oh, I’m an expert on Martian history, by the way. That’s my speciality - and we defeated them. I say we, but it was mainly the Doctor, as ever.

At the end of that, he dropped me off back in my native timezone and we, er, shook hands and said goodbye. Since then, I’ve kept myself busy. I worked at the Braxiatel Collection. I was there during that business with the Fifth Axis. I have a son, now. Loads of adventures of my own. What, you think our lives just stop and start depending on whether the Doctor's around?
Anyway. The second time I met this ‘new’ Doctor was on the planet Epsilon Minima. I was in the middle of an archaeological excavation in a coal mine, which wasn’t exactly going very smoothly...
[fade to scene one]
COMPANY OF FRIENDS — TEMPTING FATE PAGE 2
SCENE 1. EPSILON MINIMA. UNDERGROUND CHAMBER
F/X: A COAL MINE. THE CRUNCHING OF GRAVEL WHEN ANYONE MOVES
AROUND. DRILLING MACHINES BASHING AND CRACKING GREAT COALFACES. COAL SHOWERING DOWN AND PULLED AWAY ON CONVEYOR BELTS. THIS CONTINUES UNTIL WE ESTABLISH IT, THEN OVER THE
WE HEAR A SHOUTED -
OK ... Shut down, shut down.
F/X: DRILLING MACHINES WHINE DOWN
There’s nothing wrong is there, Professor Summerfield?
We’ve got enough for another survey. Give that fresh rock face a go with that gadget of yours, Klarner.
F/X: DEVICE BURBLES.
Still only a faint reading.
No change at all?
I can’t see anything.
Archaeology is usually more subtle than laser drills and mining droids. This is more like quarrying. And it would help if I knew exactly what we’re looking for.
Er.. Venhella will want to know why we’ve stopped.
That’1l be Venhella and the vast sum of money she’s paying me. Just reminding myself why I agreed to do this job blindfolded, as it were. Let’s get back to work, then. Start the drills up.
COMPANY OF FRIENDS — TEMPTING FATE PAGE 3
F/X: THE DRILLS WHIRR BACK INTO LIFE. DRILLING, AS BEFORE.
.. ONE OF THE TWO MACHINES STARTS VIBRATING AND IS
MALFUNCTIONING
Agh! Shut down, shut down!
F/X: BUT THE DRILL KEEPS GOING, OUT OF CONTROL
They’re out of control! The drills, they’ re—
F/X: A SMALL, SMART BANG AND IT STOPS. THE OTHER DRILL NOW
DOWN, AS BEFORE. AFTER A MOMENT TO LET THE DUST SETTLE, WE HEAR KLARNER CRUNCHING HIS WAY OVER
[SPLUTTERING] You OK?
[TRYING TO STIFLE HIS SPLUTTERS] Of course. We... er... we lost a couple of the robots, that’s all. And you should be wearing a hard hat and work gloves, Ms Summerfield!
Thank you so much, Mr Health and Safety. But I’m perfectly safe without - Woah! Rockfall!
F/X: CHUNKS OF ROCK SHOWER DOWN FROM THE CEILING. THEY
SETTLE.
Interesting... what have we here? Oh, more coal. [SPOTTING SOMETHING] Wait a minute... [STARTS SIFTING THROUGH COAL. AS SHE DOES SO..] What just happened, by the way?

We’ve been working these drills too hard. They’1ll need to stay shut down for a while. But it doesn’t matter. We should proceed with hand tools from now on, anyway, otherwise we run the risk of damaging something as small as - [stops himself... Er. Mm.
As small as what? Klarner! You do know what Venhella’s after, don’t you? I thought as much! You said you were as much in the dark as me!
COMPANY OF FRIENDS — TEMPTING FATE PAGE 4
[defensive] The Countess, whose terms of employment you agreed to, Ms Summerfield, made it clear that we were only to discuss immediate operational concerns with each other.
I know. But there’s always a problem working out what’s vital information and what isn’t. If I had a better idea of what we were looking for, we might have found it already. Is it this, for example?
F/X: SUDDEN CRUNCH OF FOOTSTEPS.
All you need to know -
[startled] Countess Venhella. Please don’t sneak up on us. As you can see, this is delicate stuff.
[UNIMPRESSED] What is that?
A perfectly preserved fern in the middle of the coal seam.
Please don’t get distracted. This is important work and we’re barely on schedule. Now I’m getting reports that the lift mechanism’s fused and will take hours to repair.

We’re nearly a day ahead of where we planned to be by now. After five days of a dig, that’s good, believe me. There will always be glitches. You need to be patient. And perhaps if you’d allow me to examine these mysterious ‘ancient texts’ you keep mentioning—
[VERY MESSIANIC] It is forbidden knowledge.
But not for you?
COMPANY OF FRIENDS — TEMPTING FATE PAGE 5
I have devoted my life to their study. I have come to a higher level of understanding. And you agreed not to ask any questions.
[REGRETTING IT] Yes... so I did.
[CAUGHT UP IN HER ‘QUEST’] This rock is fifty million years old. After so many millennia of solitude, it isn’t fair to expect the world to give up its secrets easily.

Er .. yes. And all that sort of thing. I was going to say ‘it’s like looking for an unidentified needle in a very dark haystack’, but you were a lot more poetic just then. Avoided the clichés. Mostly. What are you doing?
F/X: ELECTRONIC SCANNER BLEEPS.
Have either of you checked this scanner since this section was uncovered?
The drills have only just shut down, we haven’t had a chance -
Incredible.
Incredible?
It’s .. a perfect match.
You’ve found it. Congratulations, Professor Summerfield.
Found... what?
F/X: RADIO SQUAWK.
COMPANY OF FRIENDS — TEMPTING FATE PAGE 6
Security robots, secure this chamber.
F/X: WE HEAR SECURITY ROBOTS APPROACHING FROM FAR OFF DOWN
A NEARBY TUNNEL, WHIRRING ETC, MOVING FAST. ONCOMING THREAT.
Orbital unit, stand by.
[AWED] We... found it?
Er.. may I see that scanner, please?
F/X: SCANNER BLEEPS
It says whatever it is is embedded in the rock wall. Somewhere over...
F/X: FOOTSTEPS AS SHE LOOKS AROUND. BLEEPS OF SCANNER.
[READING SCANNER] Here .. wow. There is something here. Several somethings, in fact. And really quite small.
There, look! You can see it!
It? What? Oh yes... just poking out of the rock.
Take it out. You’re wearing gloves, it’s safe to.
Er... hold on. We need to make measurements, take careful note of the context.
The ‘context’ is that we’ve spent a week down a mine looking for this and now we’ve found it. Take it! fThat’s
an order!
F/X: SECURITY ROBOTS ARRIVE. ARMS CLICK AND WHIRR
MENACINGLY.
COMPANY OF FRIENDS — TEMPTING FATE PAGE 7
Security Robots reporting. Full offensive capability engaged.
Well, ‘Benny’?
Um .. OK. Just don’t tell any other archaeology professors
or I’1ll have to hand in my membership badge.
F/X: SOUNDS OF HER GLOVES AND ROCK
It’s quite loose, actually. Interesting .. a manufactured item. Actually .. are those coat buttons in there with it? Yes... fossilized buttons.
Show me the key.
Key? Is that what it is? Here. It looks familiar.
You can’t have seen anything like this. It’s the key toa TARDIS.
A... what?
TARDIS. You won’t have heard the word.
a ae
But when I touch this key, the artron differential will be
shorted. The key will be re-energised. And whichever TARDIS it belongs to will be summoned .. and it will arrive - now:
[beat]
Hmmmm .
[beat]
COMPANY OF FRIENDS — TEMPTING FATE PAGE 8
I don’t understand.
It might be because.. er..[HE’S GOT NOTHING AND JUST TAILS OFF]
Because what? [BEAT] Well shut up, then.
[beat]
Well, anyway, about my fee -
F/X: AND .. THE TARDIS MATERIALIZES
[beat]
Yes!
That’s a TARDIS?
F/X: THE TARDIS DOOR OPENS AND THE DOCTOR STROLLS OUT.
Hello. Hey, it’s dark out here. I’m the -
Doctor!
Yes, how did— ? Wait, you’re .. Benny! Bernice Summerfield. Great to see -
Um, Doctor, I don’t suppose you could give me a lift away from here?
But I’ve only just— [arrived]
Like, now?
COMPANY OF FRIENDS — TEMPTING FATE PAGE 9
‘Like now?’ Why, is there something - [the matter ]?
‘Something the matter’? Yes, I think there’s about to be!
Security robots!
Yes, they are, aren’t they? And they don’t look very friendly.
Quickly, Doctor!
Don’t let them get inside the TARDIS!
F/X: ROBOTS BLOCK THEIR PATH. METALLIC ARMS LOCK INTO
PLACE.
Oh. Look, I wasn’t intending to go back in there anyway, you know.
Grab him!
F/X: METALLIC ARMS FLEX.
‘Grab’? I really don’t feel there’s any need for any grabbing. Do you, Benny?
No, but I do feel there’s a need for some running! Down that tunnel! Come on!
F/X: THE DOCTOR AND BENNY ARE RUNNING OVER GRAVEL DURING
NEXT SEQUENCE. ROBOTS ARE TRUNDLING AFTER THEM. A LASER BOLT SIZZLES PAST.
[RUNNING] Just like old times. What’s going on?
COMPANY OF FRIENDS — TEMPTING FATE
[RUNNING] You know, I’m really not quite sure!
F/X: ANOTHER LASER BOLT IMPACTS NEARBY.
Argh! We haven’t outrun them yet! Come on!
F/X: THEY RUN OFF.
COMPANY OF FRIENDS — TEMPTING FATE PAGE 11
SCENE 2. CRANNY
NARROW TUNNEL, CLAUSTROPHOBIC
Er.. no, no, no, this is a dead end. We’ll have to double-
back.
Up there! You first!
What? I can’t get up there, I’m not a monkey.
F/X: LASER BOLT SIZZLES BY
Gah!
F/X: WE HEAR BENNY SCURRYING UP, THE DOCTOR CLOSE BEHIND.
THEIR VOICES ARE HUSHED. THEY’RE HIDING.
[SOTTO] There you go. Budge up. Tight in here.
[SOTTO] Yeah. If you just move your leg so .. yeah.
[SOTTO] Hang on... I’1ll put my arn ...
[SOTTO] Ow!
[SOTTO] Sorry.
F/X: THEY SETTLE INTO PLACE
[SOTTO] Doctor, it’s -
[SOTTO] Shush.
F/X: A ROBOT TRUNDLES PAST UNDERNEATH THEM, PAUSES, THEN
AWAY
COMPANY OF FRIENDS — TEMPTING FATE PAGE 12
[SOTTO] It can’t see us up here, let alone follow us. What is that, an IMC mining robot?
[SOTTO] Might be... whatever it is, it’s been adapted for security work. So .. what’s your plan?
[SOTTO] Years since I’ve seen one of those. [beat] Sorry?
[SOTTO] Your brilliant plan. You know who Venhella really is, and what she wants. You’re here to stop her.
[SOTTO] Who’s Venhella? Why would I need a plan? Do I need a plan? Hmmm .. better think of one.
[SOTTO] You’re the Doctor, you always arrive with a plan.
[SOTTO] Do I?
[SOTTO] You always did, anyway.
[SOTTO] Did I?
[SOTTO] Yes.
[SOTTO] Oh. Well, I’1l see what I can do, then. It’s great to see you again, by the way, Benny.
[SOTTO] You don’t look a day older.
[SOTTO] Oh, you do. I mean .. you look wonderful. Been busy?
COMPANY OF FRIENDS — TEMPTING FATE PAGE 13
[SOTTO] I think ‘yes’ just about covers that. Very long story. Oh - I have a son, now. Peter.
[SOTTO] Wow. That’s great. Where is he?
[SOTTO] He’s with his dad... it’s another long story. And how’s life treating you?
[SOTTO] Well enough. Um, back to our immediate predicament... No sign of any more robots. I think it’s safe to get down now. Come on.
F/X: THEY SCRAMBLE DOWN FROM THEIR HIDING PLACE.
Ah, that’s better. Now... Who’s this Venhella person?
Her full name’s the Countess Ninth Circle Venhella Dun Harva Eis De Sedna.
Ah .. Plutovian aristocracy.
Yes.
What are you doing with an ice heiress on a jungle planet?
Jungle planet? This is Epsilon Minima.
What? But... Epsilon Minima’s a frozen wilderness. I saw the scanner when the TARDIS landed. It was definitely a jungle.
This isn’t a jungle.
No it’s not. Hmmm. This happened to me before, but then it was a pollen-induced illusion -
COMPANY OF FRIENDS — TEMPTING FATE PAGE 14
A what?
. this time, I’m not so sure... We should probably compare notes. So .. the TARDIS detected something, was homing in on
it. Landed. I checked the scanner. Jungle. Stepped outside, you were there for the rest.

OK. I’ve been here miles below the surface of Epsilon Minima in these coal mines for five days, looking for an alien artifact with a weird energy signature. Venhella’s people detected it when they surveyed the system. She paid me to excavate it, but didn’t tell me much about what it was. It turns out it was a TARDIS key. She already knew that exposing it would set off some sort of beacon and the
would arrive. It did, and.. you were there for the rest. Any idea what Venhella wants with a Time Lord?
Perhaps she’s lonely. Us Time Lords are great company, after all.
Doesn’t seem very likely.
No? Did she mention me by name?
[thinks] No. In fact, she said ‘whatever TARDIS it belonged
to’, something like that.
I guess I was just unlucky, then.
Here’s a thought: what if she’s not after you? There have

to be a hundred things she would want to do with a TARDIS. Even if she doesn’t want to go back in time to assassinate her ex-boyfriend or whatever, there’s technology she could take. What if she’s after your ship, not you?
Good luck to her with that. It’1ll take more than a few mining robots to get past the old girl’s defences.
COMPANY OF FRIENDS — TEMPTING FATE PAGE 15
Well .. to be fair, Venhella does have the key ...
COMPANY OF FRIENDS — TEMPTING FATE PAGE 16
SCENE 3. TARDIS
F/X: THE TARDIS DOORS OPEN
Magnificent. This is the heart of the TARDIS.
I read the legends, but this is ...
Central console. Time rotor. Door control.
F/X: TARDIS DOOR CLOSES
[WONDERMENT] The forces it must be able to harness.
She. This TARDIS is a ‘she’. She’s alive, you know.
The Earth Empire has nothing like this. Nothing. I’m not sure about it counting as ‘alive’, though.
(very cold) I am.
What I mean to say is that just from a quick look at these readouts, there are things this TARDIS is capable of that are .. they’re not within the scope of human endeavour.
The Gallifreyans are ten million years in advance of us. That long ago, the ancestors of humans hadn’t even climbed into the trees, let alone come down from them.
This is incredible.

This TARDIS is alive in a way mere animals like us can never be. The Time Lord we saw won’t give her up without a fight. And it turns out that Summerfield was in league with him. How is that even possible? [beat, then a radio squawk]. Security teams, check in, please.
COMPANY OF FRIENDS — TEMPTING FATE PAGE 17
F/X: RADIO STATIC
You said this would work in here.
It should do. Try the test signal.
F/X: REGULAR ELECTRONIC BEEP
That’s being broadcast from our control centre. So signals can get through the TARDIS shielding.
I see. Get to the control centre and find out what the problem is.
Of course.
F/X: TARDIS DOOR OPENS
[almost a whisper] Don’t worry. Everything will soon be all
right.
COMPANY OF FRIENDS — TEMPTING FATE PAGE 18
SCENE 4. MINESHAFT
ECHORY TUNNEL, GRAVEL FLOOR
Can’t hear any robots. There are no security teams posted down here on the lower levels, they’re all guarding the way up.
We’re safe.
F/X: DISTANT GROWLING
[beat]
Hundreds of years old and he’s never learned about tempting fate ..
[winces]
[freaked out] Doctor? What’s the matter?
A twinge.
You get twinges?
Not often.
You never used to get twinges.
Something .. weird is happening.
F/X: MORE DISTANT GROWLING.
It feels like time is .. folding in on itself.
COMPANY OF FRIENDS — TEMPTING FATE PAGE 19
I’1ll take your word for it. And what makes that happen?

The TARDIS has defence systems. Some of them even work. If Venhella is prodding around, she might have triggered something. [A SHARP INTAKE OF BREATH, AS HE HAS ANOTHER TWINGE] This feels like the early stages of a time bubble. We need to get back to the ship and stop it.
F/X: A ROAR, QUITE CLOSE
OK. That wasn’t time bubbling or folding, that was an animal.
F/X: A ROAR IN THE MIDDLE DISTANCE, PROWLING NOISES
There! Don’t move! A lion. I mean, sort of. Some type of big cat. Green fur, blue mane. Fangs, obviously.
That’s one of the TARDIS defences? A big green lion?
F/X: ANOTHER, CLOSER, ROAR
No, Benny - that’s just a lion... thing.
I can never remember. With lions do you stand your ground and look fierce, or roll over and play dead?
F/X: VERY CLOSE ROAR INDEED, SNARLING AND SLAVERING AND
IT’S OBVIOUSLY RIGHT WITH THEM
Benny?
Yes, Doctor?
Shut up and run!
COMPANY OF FRIENDS — TEMPTING FATE PAGE 20
SCENE 5. TARDIS
F/X: CRACKLING, UNNERVING EFFECT, THE SENSE OF SOMETHING
AROUND THE EDGES OF THE ROOM. TARDIS DOORS OPEN
Countess! What is that?
It formed in the time rotor, it spread all across the ceiling in just a few minutes.
What is it, though?
She is straining against her chains. Soon she will be free.
You’ve activated the manumitter? It needs two people to operate.
One to operate, another to monitor the results. And the results are obvious.
F/X: A CRACKLE LASHES OUT
Gah!
Stay away from the console.
[horrified] My hand. Look at my hand.
Rejuvenated.
F/X: KLARNER ROLLS UP HIS SLEEVE
It’s a child’s hand .. it’s not even up to my elbow. I didn’t do anything!
COMPANY OF FRIENDS — TEMPTING FATE PAGE 21
You should be grateful that you’ve been granted such a boon.
Tecs. HOrrreiie:
It’s a gift. Try again, see if it rejuvenates the rest of you.
No! Wait .. the walls are changing. Was that a - ?
Did you make contact with the guards?

What? No. I couldn’t see them on any of the monitors. But there was quite heavy distortion. The lift’s still down, but there’s no-one there fixing it. The only thing that’s changed is the presence of the TARDIS.
And the Time Lord.
I didn’t see any evidence of sabotage, so [beat] There was definitely a face just then.
A face?
A... yes, I think so. In the wall. A pattern in the wall.
[beat] I don’t see it now.
There!
[quiet] Oh my god.
COMPANY OF FRIENDS — TEMPTING FATE PAGE 22
SCENE 6. CAVERN/JUNGLE
CAVE, VERY NARROW, ECHOEY AND CLAUSTROPHOBIC
F/X: LION ROARS A LITTLE WAY OFF
Who ever heard of a lion living down a coal mine? [beat]
Are you all right?
[weakly] This way, Benny.
You look terrible.
I’m fine.
It looks narrow, are you sure there’s going -
F/X: EVERYTHING SUDDENLY CHANGES. LIKE THE FABRIC OF
JUST WOBBLED AND RESETTLED IN A DIFFERENT FORM.
WE’RE NOW ON A MOUNTAINTOP IN A JUNGLE. A SENSE OF OPEN SPACE. EXOTIC BIRDSONG AND INSECTS
- to be room? Er.. Doctor we’re up a mountain. And you look better.
I... feel better. And we’re in a jungle. I told you I saw a jungle.
That’s the sun. But we’re three miles underground. Well, we were just now.
Oh. This is all a bit Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe, isn’t it? Except, ironically, I think we’ve just managed to evade the lion -
F/X: THE LION CREATURE ROARS, VERY CLOSE TO THE DOCTOR.
COMPANY OF FRIENDS — TEMPTING FATE PAGE 23
Look at that! Magnificent specimen when you look at him close up, isn’t he?
F/X: THERE’S A SWIPE AND A TEARING OF COAT
He got my coat!
Run!
Good idea!
Wait, not this way! No - !
[plummeting] Aaaaarrgggh!
F/X: THEY FALL, CRASHING INTO A LAGOON WITH ALMIGHTY
[splutters and ughs]
You OK?
Yeah.
Swim that way, to the shore. Not far.
F/X: SWIMMING NOISES, VOCAL EFFORT FROM DOCTOR AND BERNICE.
I’ve got it.
F/X: WE HEAR THEM EMERGING FROM THE WATER.
All right?
COMPANY OF FRIENDS — TEMPTING FATE PAGE 24
I’m dripping wet. Apart from that, I’m fine.
The lion didn’t follow us down.
Sensible lion. Look, I need to wring out my jumpsuit and empty out my boots.
At least it’s a warm day. Soon get everything dry in this sun. It’s washed off all that coal dust. Look - that lion
tore my coat pocket right off. I’ve lost some buttons.
F/X: BENNY WRINGING OUT HER JUMPSUIT
Do you mind if we stop here for a bit? Get my breath back? I was worried about you back there.
Of course. Top up your tan.
Your clothes are already dry. They’re made of special magic space fabric, of course.
F/X: MORE WRINGING
I’1l get you the address of my tailor.
It’s pretty here. All these ferns.
It is. I don’t suppose you recognize this place? Anything?
No. All I can see is a lagoon, the side of the mountain we just fell off, and some ferns.
COMPANY OF FRIENDS — TEMPTING FATE PAGE 25

So.. all in all... something of a puzzle. How do you get from a coal mine to a jungle without apparently moving an inch? I didn’t feel a transmat beam but there was something. Whatever it was, it made me dizzy.
So your theory is we moved but we didn’t move? Brilliant. Great to have you back.
Ha! Got it! Go on, guess.
Er .. something that’s just like a transmat but isn’t one really?
No. What’s all around us? What’s coal made from?
Jungle!
That’s right: plants. Miles of rock pressing down on layers of dead plants. We’ve travelled in time, but not in space. Millions of years into the past.

This jungle is what all that coal will be made of. Was made of. Was will be. I even had a fossilized fern in my hand earlier. The lion ended up traveling from here to my time. And .. your TARDIS key was in that missing pocket, wasn’t
ala oa
What?!? [CHECKING, SUDDENLY PANICKED] Oh. Yes it was. Benny, we have to get it back.
I already did, remember? It took a little while, though ...
Ah .. it fell on the ground after the lion attacked, then got buried, ended up embedded in a coal seam. Ha! I can’t even lose a key without it turning into an epic adventure.
COMPANY OF FRIENDS — TEMPTING FATE PAGE 26
OK. But why did we just travel back millions of years?
[AS IF IT EXPLAINS EVERYTHING] It’s the TARDIS defending itself.
Er.. You’re going to have to explain a little bit more than that.
One of the emergency protocols.
Bit more.
DOCTOR? To prevent Time Lord technology falling into the wrong hands.
[NOT FOLLOWING] And it does this by sending us back millions of years?

Exactly. Well, sort of. You see, the TARDIS quarantines itself. It can’t just leave time and space, not with that Venhella woman inside. So the TARDIS is creating a bubble out of a sliver of space/time, plopping the bubble out of the universe. Trouble is, there’ll be no way back once the bubble is fully formed.
And that’1ll be you and me stuck here, millions of years in the past, with no escape.
Nicely put.
Just us and the lions.
Either that, or we come up with a way back to the TARDIS before the bubble forms.
COMPANY OF FRIENDS — TEMPTING FATE PAGE 27
OK. Sounding promising so far.
We’ve got about ten minutes, by the way.
So how do we - ?
No idea. Not a clue. Not a sausage. Sorry.
Well, we - [SEEING SOMETHING] Gah!
What?
There!
Where?
There! Something was watching us. I saw eyes.
The lion?
No.
A person?
I don’t know what it was. Just look out for it while I get this jumpsuit back on.
That’s still wet. I didn’t see anything. The mind plays tricks, Benny. It was probably just branches.
[muttered] I know what branches look like. They don’t have eyes. [beat] Doctor! It’s coming.
COMPANY OF FRIENDS — TEMPTING FATE
What is?
Move!
COMPANY OF FRIENDS — TEMPTING FATE PAGE 29
SCENE 7. TARDIS
F/X: THE ANOMALOUS NOISE SURGING AND CRACKLING AWAY
Haven’t you realised what that creature is, Klarner? What she is? This is the soul of the TARDIS.
Soul is such a vague term that -
[proclaiming] TARDIS!
F/X: THE CRACKLING SUBSIDES.
I am on your side.
F/X: THE CRACKLING SEEMS TO INTENSIFY
Get the manumitter. Show it her.
Um .. all right.
[addressing the creature] This device is a manumitter.
F/X: A CHANGE IN PITCH FROM THE CRACKLING
Do you think it understood? It’s .. big, isn’t it?
It transcends dimensions.
I’m not sure it’s responding to what you’re saying.
.. you are chained. These links go deep into many dimensions, they exist in the realm of mind as well as matter.
COMPANY OF FRIENDS — TEMPTING FATE PAGE 30
F/X: THE MANUMITTER STARTS UP, A PIECE OF INDUSTRIAL
MACHINERY, BUT WITH WEIRD LITTLE COUNTERPOINTS
The manumitter will sever those chains. You will be free.
